key_insight: DuaDeep-SeqAffinity accurately predicts antigen–antibody binding affinity using only amino acid sequences via a dual-stream deep learning architecture, removing the need for 3D structural data. This enables fast, scalable affinity estimation directly from sequence information.
problem_solved: Overcomes dependency on scarce and costly experimentally determined 3D structures by providing a sequence-only method for affinity prediction between antigens and antibodies.
method: Dual-stream encoder: separate neural encoders process antigen and antibody amino-acid sequences to capture domain-specific sequence features.
Cross-modal fusion: learned interaction module (e.g., cross-attention or concatenation + MLP) integrates encoded representations to model binding-related relationships.
Regression head: downstream predictor maps fused features to a continuous affinity score, with training leveraging pre-trained protein sequence models and supervised affinity labels.
impact: Provides AI/ML practitioners a practical, scalable alternative to structure-dependent pipelines for antibody discovery, enabling high-throughput virtual screening and rapid hypothesis generation from sequence data alone.

paper_title: DuaDeep-SeqAffinity: Dual-Stream Deep Learning Framework for Sequence-Only Antigen-Antibody Affinity Prediction
paper_authors: Aicha Boutorh, Soumia Bouyahiaoui, Sara Belhadj, Nour El Yakine Guendouz, Manel Kara Laouar
